In the main text, numbers preceded by 0x are treated as hexadecimal numbers, while numbers without the prefix 0x are treated as decimal numbers.

The C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both process input files using one or more of the four steps: preprocessing (preprocessing), Hii (compilation), (assembly) MERE (linking).
The file extension suffix indicates the language of the source file, but for the compiler, the suffix controls the default setting:
gcc considers preprocessed files (.i) to be C files and sets up C-style connections.
G++ considers preprocessed files (.i) to be C++ files and sets up C++-style connectivity.
The file extension suffix indicates the language type and the post-processing operation:
.cc C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, and concatenation.
.ii  C++ files processed by the preprocessor; compiled, assembler language
.h preprocessor files; files that are not typically seen in the command line and are passed on to the linker (Linker) are typically included:
Unless the -cec,-s, or -E options were used (or a compile-time error prevented the complete process), the connection is always the final step.

In the linking stage, all files corresponding to the source program's .e file, -1 library file, and files whose names cannot be recognized (including specified .o H header files and .a library files) are passed to the linker in the order specified in the command line (OPTIONS)
The options must be given separately: "de" is completely different from "-d -r".
Most of the `=-E: and `-W' options have two different formats: -fname and -fno-name (or -Wname and -Wno-name).
These are not the default formats.
Below are the summaries of all the options, grouped by type, and explained in the subsequent chapters.
Code Generation Option – Code generation options
Make it clear that the language of the following file is language (and not the default choice inferred from the filename).
This option applies to all subsequent input files until the next -x option.language .
Close any explicit mention of the language, therefore, after processing the file based on the file name extension (e.g. "RE AS E -x").

If you only want to operate in four stages (preprocessing, compilation, linking) of some parts, you can use the "-x" option (or filename suffixes) to tell gcc where to start, and the "-c", "-s", or "-E" options to tell it where to end. Note that some combinations of options (for example, "-x cpp-output -E") are invalid in the default setting, in which GCC translates source files to ".o"
Compile and then stop, without linking.

Work is done using pipes rather than temporary files during the different stages of the compilation process, because the assemblers of those systems cannot read data from pipes, GNU's assembler does not have this problem, and the C dialects that the assembler can understand conform to the ANSI standard for C programs.

For a function declaration without parameters, such as `int foo ();', treat it in C style -- i.e., do not specify the number of parameters or their type (only for C++).
In normal cases, the function foo means that the parameters are empty in C++.

Each machine has its own default char type. It can be either unsigned char or signed char.
In ideal circumstances, when reliance on the data's symbolic nature is necessary, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char.
However, many programs have been written in simple characters, and this depends on whether they are written for a machine with symbolic or non-symbolic integers.
This option, and its inverse option, allow the program to work at the appropriate default value.
The type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it represents the same character and the same as one of them.
If no explicit modifiers such as "signed" or "unsigned" are specified, these options are used to define signed or unsigned fields.
By default, the field is signed, because the basic integer types they inherit, such as int, are signed. However, if the -traditional option is specified, the field is always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in a readable data segment and treats them as normal.
This is to accommodate some old programs, and the idea of changing a string constant to a constant is a very bad idea, and the '-traditional' option has the same effect.
The impact of COVID-19 on the drug market is particularly noticeable.
Its effects may be similar to those of the economic crisis in 2008.
The Coronavirus outbreak has created an unprecedented crisis for the entire world.

In many countries, this disease has made medical service providers barely able to cope, on the verge of collapse, and the restrictions imposed by governments have caused serious disruptions in the global economy.
For the drug market, the impact of this pandemic is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could have far-reaching consequences.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to produce the drugs, as the restriction of movement is accompanied by the restriction of the acquisition of precursors and basic chemicals.
Traffickers are unable to cross the border due to travel restrictions and may have to look for new routes and methods.
The patterns of drug use and supply, as well as the government's response capabilities, may change.
The changes brought about by COVID-19 are unprecedented, but there are still lessons to be learned from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug users began seeking cheaper synthetic substances and moving away from injecting drugs.
Meanwhile, governments worldwide have been cutting budgets related to drugs.

If governments of all countries respond to the current economic recession in the same way, prevention measures against drug abuse and related risky behaviors, and drug treatment services may be seriously affected.
Furthermore, the priority of interception operations and international cooperation may be reduced, making traffickers more mobile.
Some countries smuggle large amounts of narcotics through commercial flights, and it is expected that the narcotics trade in these countries will be most affected by this directly.

Travelers carrying methamphetamine and other synthetic drugs in carry-on bags or hidden in personal luggage sometimes bring large quantities. Because commercial air travel is now restricted almost everywhere, the use of air travel to supply drugs may be completely disrupted.
Although the international postal supply chain is also affected, the use of the Darknet and cargo shipping for smuggling may increase.
In the long term, economic recession and related restrictions may disrupt the drug market.

As a result of the rising unemployment rate and the lack of opportunities, the poor and vulnerable groups are more likely to use drugs in a harmful manner, develop drug abuse symptoms, and turn to illegal activities related to drugs, whether in the production or transportation process.
Illicit drug organizations may exploit this situation to provide services to vulnerable populations and recruit new members to expand their ranks.
With the government's response capabilities decreasing, these changes could quickly take root and become the new reality in many communities.
Expansion and complexity
The population growth model partly explains the reason for the market expansion.
Drug abuse is on the rise worldwide, regardless of whether it is measured in absolute numbers or as a proportion of the overall population.
In 2009, it was estimated that there were 210 million drug users worldwide (4.8% of the population aged 15-64), and in 2018, there were 269 million drug users (5.3% of this population).
During the past two decades, the increase in the use of drugs in developing countries has been much faster than in developed countries.

This to some extent reflects the difference in overall population growth during this period, with developed countries growing by 7%, while developing countries growing by 28%, but also reflects the faster growth in the young population in developing countries.
Teenagers and young adults are involved in the highest percentage of drug users.
During the period 2000-2018, the population of the age group in developing countries grew by 16%, while that in developed countries decreased by 10%.
1. Urbanization is a current and future driver of the drug market.
In both developed and developing countries, the situation in urban areas is worse than in rural areas.

Part of the reason for the increase in drug use is the massive migration of the population from rural areas to urban areas. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, while in 1960, this was only 34%.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of drug markets, especially in developing countries where urbanization trends are more pronounced.

Increased wealth is associated with increased drug use, but the people who bear the greatest disease burden are the poorest in the world, and drug use is more common in developed countries than in developing countries.
Cocaine and other drugs are also more closely linked to the wealthiest regions of the world.
Just as in the domestic interiors of each country, the prevalence of injecting drug abuse among the affluent social classes was higher.
However, the rate of conversion to drug addiction is higher among those with a lower socio-economic status.
Data from a few countries indicates that there is a connection between harmful drug patterns and diseases and low incomes.
These patterns seem to be less common in more affluent social classes.
Economic constraints caused by the COVID-19 crisis could worsen the risks faced by vulnerable groups, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labour market, such as unemployment rising, have been associated with the increase in drug use, but the pandemic has already forced millions of people worldwide out of work.

The related measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 have led to a reduction in air and land transportation, while sea transport may have increased due to this, sea transport is less risky, and the number of smuggled goods is greater than those smuggled by air or on land.
Recently, there have been reports of cocaine shipments directly from South America being transported by sea to Europe.
While non-controlled substances are becoming more common, new potential-risk opioids are increasing the complexity of the drug market.
Except for cannabis, cocaine, and heroin, many synthetic drugs have been added, some of which are not under international control. The use of non-medical drugs is also increasing rapidly.
Each member country's domestic market has about 500 new psychoactive substances per year.
Currently, most of them are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small amount of synthetic opioids.
Although the total number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportions have changed.
In the total number of new psychoactive substances confirmed in 2014, the opioid-like new psychoactive substances make up only 2%, but by 2018, this figure had risen to 9%.
Many synthetic opioids similar to fentanyl have been proven to have similar effects and risks, and have caused overdose deaths in North America and other regions, but in lesser degrees.

In North America, fentanyl is sometimes used as a cutting agent for heroin and other drugs (including cocaine and methamphetamine), and sometimes as a precursor for counterfeit pharmaceutical opioids.

Some evidence suggests that there is also the use of new psychoactive substances as stimulants in Europe: a study of residues in discarded syringes found in six European cities revealed that many of the syringes were contaminated with new psychoactive substances that produce a stimulant effect.
2. The use of new psychoactive substances may gradually become established in vulnerable groups.
As a large language model, you are a trained expert in mutiple languages. These are some references that might help you:
However, evidence from Europe indicates that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem in vulnerable groups such as the homeless and prisoners.
22 countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with most of them identifying synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge.

The control of precursor chemicals has forced drug manufacturers to innovate, and many chemicals used as precursors to produce amphetamine, methamphetamine, and "ecstasy" have been placed under international control.

Traffickers and drug producers are always on the lookout for substitutes, not only those with looser controls, but also those that are specifically designed to circumvent controls, i.e. so-called "precursor chemicals."
Restrictive measures aimed at preventing the spread of the coronavirus could put further pressure on those who rely on precursor chemicals to manufacture drugs.

The evidence from Mexico indicates that this is now a reality: according to reports, in March 2020, the shortage of precursors from East Asia led to a rise in the prices of methamphetamine in Mexico and the United States.
Synthetic drugs have replaced opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation.
It seems that the opiate markets in Central Asia and the Russian Federation have changed from 2008 to 2018.
The number of opioids seized by Russian federal authorities has decreased by about 80%, while the number of people receiving treatment for the use of opioids has decreased significantly.
However, the market for stimulants is growing rapidly.
There is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones, including mephedrone and a-pyrrolidinopropiophenone, are now widely available on the Russian drug market.

According to Russian authorities, the number of secret laboratories producing various illicit drugs has skyrocketed in recent years, and increased by a factor of over ten within two years, to 152 in 2018.
Afghanistan and Iraq markets for methamphetamine are growing.
As early as 2012, investigations into hospital, prison and other institutional personnel revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq.
Crystal methamphetamine has become another major cause for concern after fenethylline and tramadol.
A study in 2015 further confirmed these findings, with drug users stating that marijuana is harder to obtain than Captagon or methcathinone.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine production sites, and the Narcotics Control Bureau has expressed concern about the import of large quantities of pseudoephedrine precursors. Methamphetamine production sites will use these precursors as intermediates.
In Afghanistan, methamphetamine production appears to have begun in 2014.
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have steadily increased.
However, in the first half of 2019, the seizures amounted to 657 kg—a significant increase compared to the previous year.
Large quantities of crystallized methamphetamine believed to originate in Afghanistan have been seized in other countries, indicating that production in that country is rapidly increasing.
Most regions where marijuana is legalized for non-medical use have a trend of increasing marijuana use.
Canada, Uruguay, and the United States allow the cultivation of cannabis products for non-medical use in 11 federated regions.
In most jurisdictions, marijuana use has increased since legalization, although the same trend has been observed in jurisdictions that have not legalized recreational marijuana.

In Colorado and Washington, where marijuana was legalized the earliest, the use of marijuana by adults for non-medical purposes has increased, particularly in the past month and on a daily or near-daily basis, and has been higher than the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that since 2011, marijuana use in Uruguay has increased, with last month's use almost doubling.
This indicates that the main reason for the increase is frequent and frequent use of marijuana.
Canada's short-term data also shows that while the legal market expanded between 2018 and 2019, usage also increased.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products from illegal sources.
The reason behind the sharp drop in the global seizure of cannabis herb is the legalization of marijuana?
In 2018, the global seizure of cannabis herb fell to its lowest level in 20 years, due to a reduction in seizures in North America, which had decreased by 84% over the past 10 years.

Compared to that, the seizures in the rest of the world nearly doubled during the same period. The seizure pattern indicates that the policies aimed at loosening the cannabis market have played a key role in the decrease.
The regulation of new psychoactive substances appears to be having a deterrent effect, but the effectiveness of domestic regulation of new psychoactive substances is still difficult to assess.
Countries that have different regulatory approaches to new psychoactive substances show different patterns of use of these substances.
In other countries, the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after the introduction of national legislation.

The disadvantaged are subject to the harm of both legal and illegal drug markets for pain management and palliative care. Opioid painkillers are primarily provided for pain management in high-income countries, but they are not evenly distributed across different regions.
In 2018, more than 90% of the opioid-containing drugs available for medical use were sold in high-income countries.
Approximately 50% in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
These countries account for 12% of the global population.
According to estimates, the population of low- and middle-income countries accounts for 88% of the global population, but only 10% of the total consumption of opioid drugs.
Obtaining prescription opioids is associated with a number of factors, including legislation, culture, the healthcare system, and prescribing practices.
The risk of developing a drug addiction is higher for those who are poorer: in 2018, there were about 35.6 million people who were addicted to drugs.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization may increase the risk of drug abuse and exacerbate its consequences. This has been confirmed by studies in high-income countries, where the individual's socioeconomic trajectory is not just their condition at a particular point in time, but also related to the risk of drug abuse.

Drug abuse symptoms also deepen social and economic disadvantages, further increasing the risks of unemployment, poverty, and homelessness, thus reinforcing the vicious cycle of disadvantage. These results may also be related to demeaning attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, minorities, migrants, LGBTQ groups, internally displaced persons, and those who have become homeless due to armed conflict or natural disasters, as well as those living in rural areas, may also be disproportionately affected by drug addiction, or may face problems in obtaining treatment.

According to the disability-adjusted life years (DALY) indicator for years of healthy life lost due to disability caused by illness or injury, the negative impact of harmful drug use has become more widespread in the past 10 years.
From 2007 to 2018, the total disability-adjusted life years attributable to drug use increased by 17%.
Liver cancer related disability adjusted life years (DALYs) are particularly high in people with untreated hepatitis C in the injecting drug user population—at 40%.
The links between drugs and violence are complex and difficult to determine the causal relationships between the use of psychotropic substances and violence.
Global data indicate that intoxication may be an important factor in murder.
However, in violent events, alcohol seems to have a greater effect than drugs.

While drug use may lead to crime, in some cases, this connection can be partly attributed to a variety of intermediary factors, such as social and economic disadvantages, as well as other types of adversity caused by individual risk, family environment, and peers in the context of adolescence.
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, including large-scale organized crime activities such as international drug trafficking, these activities may be carried out without violence.

In the short term, the level and extent of violence is not so much determined by the amount of trafficking, but rather by certain changes in the balance of power between organized criminal groups, such as changes in the size of the illegal market, the death or imprisonment of a famous criminal, and legal measures that make one group weaker than another.
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance, and opioids cause the most harm.
According to estimates, there were 1.92 billion people who used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug globally.
In 2018, 58 million people used opioids.
However, the related dangers of opioids are often overlooked because they are used by fewer people.

Of the estimated 167,000 deaths in 2017 related to drug use disorders, 66% were caused by these substances, and in the 210 million years of life lost due to disabilities or premature deaths attributed to drug use, 50% were caused by these substances.
The use of synthetic opioids for non-medical purposes has exacerbated the public health crisis.

In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the aggravating factor is tramadol; in North America, it is fentanyl. These regions have little in common in terms of economic, demographic, or drug-use statistics, but they are both struggling to fight the opioid crisis that is fueled by easily accessible and cheap substances.
In North America, the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids has led to an increase in the number of overdose deaths from opiates over the past 20 years.
In 2018, there were 67,367 overdose deaths in the United States, and two-thirds of them involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
Part of the reason why fentanyl is so deadly in illegal drug markets is that its effects are unpredictable.
In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the market for non-medical use of tramadol has grown significantly.
In 2017, global tramadol seizures reached a peak of over 125 tons.
However, after a new law regulating tramadol was passed in India in 2018, global seizures fell to 32 tons.
The crisis in these two locations was caused by simple and low-cost production, as well as the lack of international oversight of fentanyl-like substances and precursors.
These substances are problematic because they are available on both the legal and illegal markets, making it harder to detect and prevent their abuse.
Stimulants are becoming increasingly popular.
The stimulant market is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine, and both of these substances are increasingly used in their main markets.
There were about 19 million people who used cocaine in 2018, because cocaine is quite popular in North America and Western Europe.
Approximately 27 million people used methamphetamine in 2019, of which methamphetamine was the most commonly used ATS in Southeast Asia and North America.
Based on the majority of indicators, methamphetamine use in these two regions has been increasing for the past 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist, sometimes replacing each other, so that when the use of one drug increases, the use of the other decreases, sometimes simultaneously increasing and decreasing to meet the needs of the same market.
COVID-19 increases the risk for intravenous drug users.
More than 1.6 million people who inject drugs have HIV and 5.5 million have Hepatitis C.

In 2017, there were approximately 585,000 deaths due to drug abuse, of which 50% were caused by liver disease caused by Hepatitis B, and many of the Hepatitis B carriers injecting drugs have not yet received treatment.

As a result of COVID-19 restrictions, there may be a shortage of opioids, which could lead to the use of alcohol or benzodiazepines, which are easier to obtain, or the mixing of opioids with synthetic drugs.
As more users switch to injection or more frequent injections, there may be more harmful use patterns.

EU officials debate refugee policy, EU officials: Process is a bottleneck from start to finish - China News Network
EU summit: Refugee policy disputes rage on, EU officials: Acceptance process is fraught with bottlenecks at every step

According to the Global Times on February 10, at the latest EU summit held on that day, EU Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said that EU leaders agreed to adopt stricter policies on illegal immigration, which would make it easier to expel illegal immigrants.

According to reports, this is the EU's response to the increasingly pressing issue of illegal immigration in Europe, and now, the EU's central issue is that the number of illegal immigrants who can ultimately be deported is very small.

According to the meeting documents, EU leaders called for the committee "to immediately mobilize large amounts of EU funds," using infrastructure and monitoring measures to strengthen the external border.
However, the EU and its member states are still at odds over the cost of fencing.

However, some diplomats from the member states claimed that if the EU could share the responsibility for installing cameras, towers, and other infrastructure along the external border, this would free up national budgets and thus accelerate the construction process.

The Euractiv website in Europe reports that EU officials admit that every step of the refugee reception process is fraught with bottlenecks, with limited reception capacity and overburdened immigration authorities in the member states, which cannot prevent refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in the EU countries, and the EU's refugee reception system is in a state of near-permanent crisis.
According to the European Commission, the Schengen countries received more than 920,000 asylum applications in 2015, an increase of nearly 50% over the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded over 330,000 illegal entries last year.
In this context, the summit also reached an agreement on a "principle," namely that EU countries can deport illegal immigrants to another member state based on a court ruling from that country.
Additionally, reports indicate that the EU leaders agreed to "increase the use of the concept of security states," which will open the path for the EU to establish a common list.

Recently, the "semiconductor war" between the United States and China has been upgraded. First, under the pressure from the Netherlands and Japan, the two countries agreed to impose controls on the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China; later, foreign media reported that the US government is considering cutting off all ties between US suppliers and Huawei; and the Biden administration is also preparing to issue an executive order to restrict investment in sensitive

In recent years, the United States has never ceased its attacks on China's "chips" development, on the one hand, it has been carrying out precise suppression of the Chinese semiconductor supply chain, on the other hand, it has been building a semiconductor industry alliance with a "de-sinicization" goal, aiming to completely "outpace" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.
However, the United States's "chip strategy" against China is also "one thousand injured, self-damaged eight hundred."

Recently, the US-based chip manufacturing equipment supplier Lam Research Group announced that the company's operations were affected by the latest round of restrictions on the export of China-made chip manufacturing equipment, and the company would lay off 1,300 full-time employees and plan to lay off 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters.
The world's largest stepper manufacturer, ASML Holding, recently warned that a ban on the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China could lead to a rise in semiconductor prices.

According to US media, after the US government imposed brutal and unreasonable repression on the semiconductor and chip industries in China, many US companies were seriously affected, including chip design automation tool developers, chip designers, semiconductor wafer manufacturing equipment producers, and chip manufacturers themselves.
As the United States claims to be suppressing China's advanced semiconductor industry, it has dragged down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a highly capital-intensive and highly knowledge-intensive industry, and a global semiconductor industry chain has already been formed that is tightly interconnected.

According to estimates by professional experts, the entire production process for semiconductor products requires crossing the borders of multiple countries more than 70 times, and the entire process takes about 100 days.

Although the US semiconductor industry is strong in terms of its foundation, it is weak in terms of manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced processes, and is heavily dependent on the East Asian region.

Even though the United States has done its utmost to steer advanced chip supply chains towards its "closed circle" regions, it is difficult to change the regional distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor industry.
The United States is "reforming" and "de-Sinicizing" the semiconductor industry chain with great force, which will severely damage the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the future industry, and the development of the chip industry cannot be achieved without the participation of all countries around the world.

Over the past few years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively promulgating the "Innovation and Competition Act", the "2022 U.S. Competition Act", and the "Chip and Science Act", to use the power of technological hegemony to consolidate its technological superiority; it has coerced its allies with threats and rewards, and has forced Intel,
In the short term, the United States has indeed created problems for China's semiconductor industry and related industries, resulting in tangible benefits.

However, in the long run, the U.S. will continue to suppress China, which will force the Chinese chip industry to keep breaking through, and ultimately lose the huge Chinese market, which will greatly weaken the innovation intent and innovation ability of U.S. technology companies, and damage the development of the global chip industry.
The first batch of personal pension investment products went on sale.
The 7 products of the family institution can be selected with a minimum duration of 360 days.
Personal retirement savings products are finally available.

At this point, the "shelves" of the individual pension savings account finally have the four types of products: savings, investment, insurance, and publicly-traded funds for individual pension savings.

According to the introduction, the first batch of personal pension investment products for retirement, all of which are publicly-traded net asset value open-end funds, with a total of 5 new products and 2 continuing products. The only mixed-type product is one, while the remaining 6 are fixed-income type products.

The Beijing Youth Daily reporter saw that of the five new products, four came from Wealth Management of the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, all of which were fixed-income products, and the minimum holding period ranged from 365 days to 1080 days. The corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70%-4.20%, 4.10%-4.60%,

The remaining new product is "Postal Savings Fortune Addition Hongjin 1095-day Short Term Bond," which is a fixed income product. It began collecting on February 10 and ended on February 19. The risk level is two.

From the two surviving products, one is the agricultural bank financial products "Shinian Lingdong" 360-day science and technology innovation RMB savings product, with investment nature as mixed type, and risk level as level 3.

Another surviving product is "Hongxin Hengji Hengxiang 365 Days 1", a fixed-income product, which was launched for fundraising on December 30, 2021, and officially started operating on January 4, 2022. On February 8, its net asset value was 1.0011.

According to the "Opinions of the State Council General Office on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Funds", individual pension fund assets can be invested in financial products including bank savings, deposits, commercial pension insurance, and publicly traded funds.

The first retirement savings products are being released, which marks the beginning of individual retirement savings investors being able to officially purchase retirement savings products through their individual retirement savings accounts.
The Pension Supervisory Authority issued the "Interim Measures for the Management of Individual Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Financial Management Companies" in November last year.

According to the regulations in the "Measures", participants can purchase individual pension savings through their individual pension savings accounts, individual pension savings investment products, individual pension savings insurance products, and individual pension savings publicly-traded fund products.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxes issued a notice, clarifying that the individual pension system would be implemented in Beijing, Tianjin, and Hebei Shijiazhuang, the Xiongan New Area, and Jincheng, Shanxi, as well as in 36 pilot cities and regions including Changchun, Changsha, Chengdu,
As of the end of 2022, the number of participants in the individual pension was 19.54 million, the number of payers was 6.13 million, and the total amount of payments was 142 billion yuan.
Previously, the banks participating in the pilot only listed three types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension publicly-traded funds.
Today, the personal pension investment products have gathered together, and how should the investor choose?

Expert from the WeBank wealth management product development department said that compared with other individual pension products, the pension products during the pilot stage and individual pension products have three features in common.
One is stability, risk management is more comprehensive, investment strategies and concepts are more robust, and independent third-party custody is implemented.
Three, affordability, the purchase threshold is low, generally starting at 1 yuan, some as low as 0.01 yuan, and the fees for deposit, management, and other charges are also more affordable.

The fitness industry should overcome the trust crisis - China News Network
Recently, the issue of the rights of the members of the well-known fitness center Healthy Fitness attracted public attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members discovered that their stores were not operating normally, and then rumors about the closure and runaway of the institution caused members to panic, leading to the intervention of the public security and social security departments.
Finally, the relevant responsible person came forward to respond and promised to do their best to protect the legal rights of employees and members, which allowed the dispute to be resolved.
Some fitness facilities have temporarily closed individual branches due to operational issues. Why is it that many members' first reaction is "something is wrong?"
The controversy over the fitness club's member's rights is rooted in a deeper social problem of industry trust issues.
Traditional fitness centers in China generally operate on a prepaid model, with "making money from users who don't come" being the underlying logic of their development.

By selling pre-paid membership cards, opening new stores, it may appear that the company is generating cash flow in a continuous cycle, but in reality, the company is eating its seed corn, and is unable to establish a stable profit model.
Negative news about the fitness center industry is frequently reported, which has a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the perspective of market prospects, gyms can be considered to be a good business with "money-making potential."
While the fitness trackers may have had ups and downs, they have always been in the spotlight of investors.
Data shows that consumption in the cultural and entertainment sectors is on the rise, and the market is continuing to recover.
The situation is improving, and this calls for greater attention to quality development.

However, some institutions are overly optimistic about the fitness market after the recovery of consumer spending, just as they are emerging from the crisis, and are calling for the opening up of new markets and the investment of funds in the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that many institutions have withdrawn in recent years due to the epidemic, and the industry is undergoing a reshuffle. It is not a bad thing for the strong enterprises to selectively increase their acquisition strength and reconfigure their layouts in this context.
However, in order for the fitness market to enter a positive feedback loop and move towards a prosperous future, the industry must change its traditional approach and its operating strategies.
Only through a sustained effort to rebuild consumer trust and safety can one truly win the market and the future.
In comparison to opening new stores to capture the market, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing its services, and to do so with high-quality development to keep users.
First of all, it is necessary to retain users with good service.
Health clubs are in the service industry. Their essence is to "put the user first," and they should focus on improving service quality and upgrading.
Secondly, we need to enhance user experience through digital transformation.
For example, the popular Internet fitness room model that allows users to pay per use and choose the location.
At the same time, the data of the body and the data of exercise can be effectively used, and social needs can be met, thus achieving a complete service cycle from online to offline.
There is no pushy sales, no expensive annual memberships, and users' concerns about fitness facilities "running away" have been reduced, and trust has also increased.
In addition, other diversified industries should be explored.

Today, fitness consumption has moved from single-service to scene-based consumption, and fitness clubs are expected to become a new gateway for consumption. Around the needs of sports nutrition and exercise equipment, and other related products, fitness clubs may become a new source of profit, and provide consumers with more choices.

Many economic indicators are declining, and Taiwan's economic performance at the beginning of the year is poor - China News Network

Xinhua News Agency, Taipei, February 11 (Reporter Zhao Bo, Huang Yang) Taiwan's export trade volume "hit five consecutive black numbers", and the purchasing manager index (PMI) for manufacturing has been contracting for seven consecutive months. The consumer price index (CPI) has also hit "three digits"... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have successively released economic data for January 2023.
Expert analysis suggests that Taiwan's economy started the year poorly, with growth pressure not small.

According to the Financial Administration Department of the Taiwan authorities, the export of Taiwan region in January this year was 31.51 billion US dollars, down 21.2%, for 5 consecutive months of negative growth.
The export volumes of the 11 major export goods were all down compared with the same period last year.
Plastics and rubber products, as well as optical instruments, fell the most, with a drop of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
Electronic components exports fell by 20.1% annually, the biggest drop in 11 years.
In particular, integrated circuits fell 18.3% year-on-year, the largest decline in 14 years.
Chief Statistician Tsai Mei-Nan said that this indicated that the demand for consumer electronics was weakening, and that the electronic industry was entering a correction period.
Statistics show that in January, the exports and imports of Taiwan region fell, with exports exceeding the amount of 23.4 billion US dollars, which was the lowest level in the past three years.

The Financial Affairs Department of the Taiwanese government believes that the demand for end-products has decreased globally, which has suppressed the desire of manufacturers to purchase raw materials, and the export slump is short-term and is unlikely to improve in the near future. The first quarter export decline in Taiwan this year is feared to be higher than expected.

According to the Chung-Hua Institution for Economic Research, the Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for Taiwan in January after seasonal adjustment was 40.4%, down 3.3 percentage points from the previous month, and contracted for the seventh consecutive month.
In the economic monitoring system, the PMI line is 50%, and if the index is above 50%, it indicates an expansion in the economy, and below 50%, it indicates contraction.
In the Taiwan PMI five-component index, new orders, production and employment contracted, while supplier delivery time declined, and inventories contracted.

The six industries all reported PMI contraction, and the industries were ordered according to the contraction rate, with the electrical and mechanical equipment industry (35.1%), the electronic and optical industry (35.2%), the chemical and biotechnology medical industry (39.2%), the basic raw material industry (42.4%), the transportation industry (42.6%), and the food and textile industry (45

Prices wise, the “Taiwan’s Main Board of Accounts” announced that the CPI annual inflation rate in Taiwan in January was 3.04%, which was the second time in a row that it had surpassed 3% since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables rose by 28.25%, a new high in 17 months.

The Tawain "Council of Economic Planning", special commissioner Cao Zhixiang admitted that the price of vegetables has actually exceeded expectations, excluding the effects of the Spring Festival, the average CPI in January and February should be close to 2.71% in December, and inflation pressure still exists, and it is still at a high point.
Taiwan's economy is expected to be gloomy this year, according to the reports of local media such as "Yahoo Finance" and "United Daily News," and experts are pessimistic.

Professor Wu Daren of the Department of Economics at Central University in Taiwan analyzed that a downturn in exports may lead to cash flow problems for export manufacturers and increase the risk of default on debt.
Meanwhile, the decline in orders results in a reduction in labor costs for manufacturers, which affects the labor market and family economy, and in turn impacts consumption capability.

Chu Dasheng, research fellow at the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, believes that the inflationary situation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved this year, and demand continues to contract. He estimates that Taiwan's export decline will continue into the second half of the year.
Due to the fact that the Taiwanese economy is dependent on exports, the economic growth rate for the whole year will be lower than last year, as a result of the sluggish export situation.

Shenzhen: Building the first and leading city in China and the world in terms of extreme speed and leading-edge technology - China News Service

China News Service, February 11 - According to the "Shenzhen Industry and Information" WeChat public account, the Shenzhen Municipal Bureau of Industry and Information Technology issued the "Shenzhen City Action Plan for the Rapid Advance of Smart Cities" on February 10.
The plan proposes to accelerate the upgrade to gigabit fiber networks.
By the end of 2023, the proportion of 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of full-optical industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires that 5G networks be optimized in terms of energy efficiency.
Research and establish the standards and criteria for the quality of 5G network services in Shenzhen, carry out 5G network testing and evaluation, and improve the quality of 5G network services.

Support the telecommunications industry to strengthen the optimization of 5G networks in key areas and locations, and increase the number of 5G base stations by 10,000 throughout the year. The average download speed in major cities is 500 Mbps, and the upload speed is 100 Mbps, with download speeds of 1 Gbps and upload speeds of 200 Mbps in key areas, and
Create high-quality wireless LANs at city level.

Develop a standard for WLAN service in public places and promote the upgrade of WLAN in densely populated and information consumption-intensive areas in all districts in the city. Provide 1 Gbps access capabilities.

We will build a unified authentication management platform for public wireless local area networks in the city based on the "Shen i Net" project, and achieve "one-time authentication, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching". This will support operating entities to include APs (wireless access points) with public service capabilities in the authentication management platform.
Upgrading AP connections will be completed by the end of 2023, with a total of at least 20,000 APs connected.

In addition, the Plan also proposes to build a high-quality all-optical transport network, build a multi-level data processing system, speed up the construction of key communication network facilities, and enhance Internet application service capabilities.
The plan clearly states that it will build a collaborative system for the Internet of Things.

Deepen the application of intelligent sensing in urban management, public services, public security, transportation, and other fields. Expand the collection channels for fixed sensing in urban roads, buildings, and public facilities, as well as for intelligent networked vehicles.

By the end of 2023, the number of intelligent sensing terminals for water, electricity, gas, and the Internet of Things will exceed 9 million, and 20 pilot projects will be established to demonstrate the application of multiple-functional smart lampposts.

The plan also states that efforts should be made to promote the integration of satellite and terrestrial communications, build low-altitude network infrastructure, and promote the in-depth coverage of 5G networks in the sea.

At the same time, we should promote in-depth coverage of 5G networks in the ocean, build an innovative development ecosystem for the industry, and support the hosting of world-class events and activities.

At the same time, content becomes the foundation and handle of the new stage of e-commerce development, and PGC content such as knowledge payments, professional knowledge, and KOL (key opinion leaders) begins to become standard in e-commerce live broadcasts.

The 16th China-Japan Energy Conservation and Environmental Protection Comprehensive Forum was held in Beijing. He Lifeng attended the main forum and delivered a keynote speech.

Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, February 11th: On February 11th, the 16th China-Japan Energy Conservation and Environmental Protection Comprehensive Forum was held in Beijing in a combination of online and offline formats.

He Liifeng pointed out that the holding of this forum is an important measure for implementing the consensus reached by President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Fumio Kishida at the Manila summit and strengthening green development cooperation between China and Japan.

(Deutsche Welle) The Biden administration added six Chinese entities to the blacklist on February 10, suspected of involvement in the spy balloon scheme.

Companies on the blacklist have a hard time obtaining US technology exports.

The list is called the "entity list," and companies on the list will not be able to purchase technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they have received special export permits from the U.S. Department of Commerce.

The following companies are on the blacklist: Beijing Nanjiang Space and Aerospace Technology Co Ltd, the 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group, Linghao Remote Sensing Technology Co Ltd, Yongmen Aviation Technology Group Co Ltd, Guangzhou Tianhai Xianghang Aviation Technology Co Ltd, and Shanxi Yongmen Aviation Technology Group Co Ltd.

The balloon incident further strained the relationship between China and the US, and US Secretary of State, Blinken, cancelled his trip to China.

China's government sent a formal protest to the U.S. embassy in China on February 4, criticizing the U.S. for seriously undermining and damaging the efforts and progress of stabilizing and improving bilateral relations between the two countries.

Based on existing debris evidence and information from the Chinese military procurement platform, the US government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon has a direct relationship with the Chinese People's Liberation Army and is a supplier approved by the Chinese military.

Mao Ning, spokesperson of the Foreign Ministry, said at a press conference on Friday that regarding the accidental intrusion of a Chinese unmanned aircraft into U.S. airspace due to force majeure, China has repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the resolutions of the US Congress are nothing but political maneuvering and stunts.
China is firmly opposed to and strongly dissatisfied with that.

Assistant Commerce Secretary Axel Rodrigues de Arruda, Matthew Axelrod, said: "Today's actions show that we are working together to stop China's use of espionage balloons that violate the airspace of the United States and over 40 countries.

The Google AI chatbot "got the answer wrong" and the parent company's stock evaporated 10 billion dollars.

Google's new artificial intelligence chatbot Bard has been a flop, as it "answered the wrong questions" in a promotional video, causing Google parent company Alphabet's stock to plummet 8.9% on Thursday, falling below $100 and losing $110 billion in market value (about RM476.5 billion) as of Friday's closing.
Market participants are concerned that Alphabet will not be able to keep up with its competitor Microsoft.

According to a report by Reuters, Google released a promotional video of its AI chatbot Bard on social media earlier, in which someone asked Bard: "What are the latest discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST)? for my 9-year-old child?"
Bard mentioned that the telescope had taken the first picture of an extrasolar planet.

However, according to data from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first photograph of an extrasolar planet was taken by the European Southern Observatory's "Extremely Large Telescope" in 2004.
"Bard's answer is wrong, Alphabet's stock price plummets," reports Reuters in a headline.

On the other hand, Google states that Bard's response "demonstrates the importance of rigorous testing processes," and that it will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's responses "meet high standards for quality, safety, and authenticity."
Singapore's tourism industry is recovering strongly, with the number of incoming tourists growing by 19 times compared to 2021.

(Compiled on November 11) The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that it expects international visitors to New Zealand to reach 12 to 14 million in 2023, which will bring about about 18 to 21 billion new dollars in tourism revenue; visitor numbers and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of pre-COVID-19 levels in 2021; and there
The Singapore tourism market is gradually restarting and recovering in 2022.

According to the latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board, the number of visitors entering the country in 2022 increased by 19 times compared to 2021, reaching 6.3 million, surpassing the tourism board's earlier estimate of 4 million to 6 million people, and visitor numbers have already recovered to 33% of pre-pandemic levels.

In the first nine months of 2022, Singapore tourism receipts totaled S$8.96 billion, and it is estimated that tourism receipts for the whole year could reach S$13.8 billion to S$14.3 billion, an increase of 6 times to 7 times compared to the S$1.89 billion in 2021, and have already recovered to about 50% to 5
The Singapore government is taking multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced a budget of nearly 5 billion ringgit to stimulate the revival of the tourism industry.
The Tourism Bureau recently announced that it will allocate 1.1 billion new dollars from this budget over the next two years to introduce more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists.

To make health and wellness become one of Singapore's tourist attractions, the Singapore Tourism Board released a call for expressions of interest on November 23, 2022 to develop a health and wellness destination along the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Lingli, director of the Sports and Wellness Tourism Bureau of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have placed their health in the forefront of all considerations.

Developing a health and wellness destination in Marina South, which includes Gardens by the Bay and Marina Barrage, will help contribute to Singapore's tourism industry and economy, and encourage visitors to spend more time in Singapore.
Singapore Tourism Board Chairman Chen Jianlong said that in the coming few years, health and wellness will become an important component of Singapore's tourism products.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held its first Health and Wellness Festival, offering more than 130 different health activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to provide new travel experiences for visitors.

In addition to the newly opened Singapore Children's Museum, Gardens by the Bay's Avatar World, Sentosa Central Beach Market, and the new "Explore New Horizons" exhibition hall at the ArtScience Museum, the Tourism Board will support the development and upgrading of Wildlife Safari World's Jurong Bird Park and other projects, making Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will establish relevant industry standards for conferences, exhibitions and incentive travel in the field of sustainable tourism by the end of 2023, and will focus on improving the problems of waste disposal and carbon emissions, further optimizing the tourism environment.
Singapore's tourism recovery has sped up the recovery of the aviation industry.

As of December 18, 2022, Changi Airport passenger traffic has recovered strongly, with over 150,000 passengers per day, about 1 million per week, which is about 75% of pre-pandemic levels. The number of airline staff on duty has also recovered to about 90% of pre-pandemic levels.
Data shows that in the first 10 months of 2022, Singapore welcomed 23.6 million tourists, which is 42% of the pre-pandemic level, with 170,000 flights, which is 53% of the pre-pandemic level.
Tourism is recovering quickly, and this is also helping the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, dining, and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high expectations for the Chinese market.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, approximately 3.6 million Chinese tourists visited Singapore for vacation each year.
As China's border policy has been relaxed, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists this year will recover to 30% to 60% of the number in 2019.
Kuo Shu-tan pointed out that the tourism bureau will closely monitor the signals for the further release of China's outbound travel policies, so as to respond to the changing needs of tourists.

The Singapore Tourism Board, in addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies, will also actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists to overseas destinations to respond to new trends in China.

The Singapore Tourism Board is optimistic about the tourism market in 2023, believing that as long as the global economy does not experience a significant decline in income affecting the public, and there are no new large-scale fatal epidemics, the tourism industry will recover faster than expected.

(Compiled on 11th) The 75th anniversary parade of the Korean Army was held on the evening of the 8th, and Kim Jong-un's daughter Kim Jong-ae not only attended, but also stood on the podium with her father.

He even touched his father's chest with his hands, and their father-daughter interaction scenes were broadcast to the entire nation.

According to reports by the South Korean media outlets "Chosun Ilbo" and "JoongAng Ilbo", Kim Jong-un and Ri Sol-ju couple attended an official dinner together with their daughter Kim Ye-ae, where Kim Ye-ae not only sat in the center of her parents, but also appeared with Kim Jong-un on the main stage during the 75th anniversary parade on the next day.
After the parade, North Korea's state media, the Central Television of North Korea, released a video of the parade, revealing more scenes of Marcy and Hunson.

Kim Jong-un stood several times next to his daughter, smiling, and they exchanged whispers in each other's ears. Kim Jong-un even once raised his father's cheeks with both hands and smiled back at him.

Other media images also show that Kim Jong-un loves to sit with Kim Jong-un on an indoor sofa, and touch his father's face with his hands; she walks with her father, holding his hand, while touching his chest with her hand.

"Fund E Accounts" Have Arrived: The Securities Regulatory Commission Authorizes Their Development, and Investors Can Realize the Consolidation and Inquiry of All Funds in Their Names - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Chen Xin, a reporter for Economic Observer, said that the complex fund purchase channels make it difficult to aggregate account information.
Do you always forget the "little treasury"?
The problems of the common people will soon be solved.
The SEC announced on February 10 that the "E Fund Account" app was available for download from various mobile application stores and underwent public testing.

According to the introduction, "Fund E account" provides a "one-stop" query service for personal investors to access information about public fund accounts and shares. This is intended to solve the pain points of the industry, such as forgetting account numbers and having to deal with complicated procedures.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 public fund management companies in China, managing fund assets of about 2.6 trillion yuan; there were 167 fund registration agencies for public fund sales, and 411 agencies for public fund sales.
The accounts of the various registration agencies are independent of each other, and there is no unified search channel for the industry.
Industry insiders say that at the end of 2021, there were more than 720 million fund investors in China, which means that half of the country's population invested in fund products.

Prior to this, investors would have to inquire about their purchase history from different sales channels, but by using "Fund E accounts," they can view all of their purchases across all sales channels, and can also see their holdings in the fund.
What is the E-Fund Account APP?

According to related documents, the "Fund E Account" APP is a public fund management industry mobile application developed and built by the CSRC, which can provide investors with a one-stop inquiry service for the off-exchange holdings of all public fund products.

Investors can easily and quickly track the holdings of all the mutual funds they purchased through various channels in the market through their "fund E account", thereby improving the query efficiency.

Specifically, investors can find the information about the fund account through "E fund account" on the platform. The information includes: information about the fund account opened at the management person of publicly-traded funds in the whole market, information about the trading account opened at the sales agency of publicly-traded funds, and information about the number of investors holding off-exchange shares of funds and securities companies, which are not subject to the 20

Liu Yicheng, the head of the Research Center for the Evaluation of Securities and Funds at the Shanghai Securities Funds Research Institute, told the Economic Observer that investors can learn about their holdings of all off-exchange mutual funds through the “Fund E Account” app, which helps them recover their “forgotten assets,” and also helps them aggregate the full account information of their comprehensive fund investments, which will
How register for API?

Reporters have noticed that the “fund E account” APP has been put on the shelves in the application stores of Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, and vivo, but the APP is still in the public beta stage, and users need to enter an invitation code to register. Investors can contact the fund management company that holds the fund to obtain the invitation code.

A customer service representative from a large publicly traded fund in Shanghai provided an investor with a six-digit invitation code to Economic Observer and told the reporter, "The APP is in its trial phase, and China Knotting is providing a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager. Investors can call in to obtain them. We will provide them as well."
After the trial run is over, users can register without invitation codes.

The reporter downloaded and used the relevant documents of the "fund E account" published on the official website of the SFC, and completed the registration and query process in a short time. The whole process mainly consisted of four steps: user registration, real name verification, fund account binding, and public fund query.

After the verification process, click the "Asset" fund link button to see all the funds purchased by the reporter on various fund sales platforms (can be linked to an account), and then you can start using the query function after completing the link. All the total assets of the funds purchased by the reporter can be seen in the list of link options.
It is worth noting that the "Fund E Account" is only a query service for investors and does not allow for redemption and buying and selling.
The data displayed by the E Fund account generally reflects the acquisition date (T day) plus three trading days in the past.

For example, if you open the "Fund E account" on February 10, the total assets, the number of shares, and the net asset value displayed on the Assets page correspond to the date three trading days prior to that, namely February 7.

The French trade unions have once again organized a large-scale protest against the government's pension reform policy.

On Saturday (February 11), French unions once again called for a nationwide mobilization against the government's pension reform proposal, calling on citizens to take to the streets to voice their opposition.
This is the fourth D-Day for the social movement against the government's pension reform proposal.
But how many people will respond to their calls? This may affect the next step of the action plan of the labor union groups.

This is the fourth time in a month that eight major French trade unions have collectively organized a nationwide mobilization, and it is the first time that a rally has been scheduled for Saturday for this protest.

Given that for most French people Saturday is a day off, they do not need to choose between participating in a demonstration and a strike to protest wage cuts, and the trade union organizations therefore hope that today's meeting activities will attract more people to participate.

The unions of public transportation systems, subways, and railways today have not called for a strike, the public transportation system should be able to operate normally, and citizens can travel to the rally sites by car, while in areas where school vacations are starting, people can travel normally on vacation.

The trade union groups hope that today more than one million people will attend the demonstration, while the police expect a national turnout of between 600,000 and 800,000 people, and up to 90,000 to 120,000 in the Paris region.

Since the start of the protests against the pension reform plan that opposes government policies, although the majority of the French people do not support the measure of postponing the official retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people who actually went out on the streets to participate in the demonstrations has gradually decreased.
The protesting crowds have shrunk to between 7.5 million and 20 million people nationwide this week on Tuesday, February 7.
A pension reform proposal is currently under discussion at the French National Assembly.
The opposition parties, especially those led by radical leftists, submitted numerous amendment proposals, which slowed down the legislative process considerably.

The radical left-wing party, the Front de Libération du Travail, recently posted a picture of a balloon with the image of the Minister of Labour on social media, which caused the ruling party to protest.
The Speaker of the National Assembly finally announced a ban on the member's participation in parliamentary activities for 15 days as punishment for this behavior.

Although this reform plan has triggered the largest social movement in France in the past 20 years, the government has made some minor changes to the draft, but there has been no major concessions so far.

The last chairman of the communist party in East Germany died today.
The successor of the East German Communist Party was reported in a statement to have died last night, Hans Modrow, at the age of 95.

On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall was opened after 28 years of separating East Berlin from Western powers, Mdouro said he would help to turn East Germany into a democratic country.
At that time, the protesters in the various regions of East Germany demanded democracy and freedom, forcing the Communist leaders to resign.
Mikhail Gorbachev, who led the Soviet Union after the fall of the Soviet Union, demanded reforms in the East European countries under Soviet domination.
On 18 March 1990, Mdrola announced the first and only free elections in the GDR.
The election results led to him not being re-elected as prime minister.
Although Mobutu made reforms, the opponents accuse him of trying to delay the political changes and reunification that occurred in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to reform rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Mordor was convicted of electoral fraud in the 1989 municipal elections, but did not go to prison.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German parliament, and from 1999 to 2004 he served as a Member of the European Parliament.
Mordor sees himself as a reformer and hopes to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters that he did not want the former East Germany to return, but did admit that its achievements should be acknowledged.
Mordor was born in Jasenitz, a small German town in 1928, and received training as a mechanic.

During World War II, he was a squad leader in the fire brigade and, when the conflict was about to end, he became a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi paramilitary organization that recruited men aged 16 to 60 to participate in the final battle.
In 1945, at the age of 17, Modrow was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union, where he participated in anti-fascist courses and became a firm communist.
1949, the year of the founding of East Germany, he returned home and found a job as a mechanic, and continued his studies in social sciences and economics, and obtained a doctorate.
Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany in 1990 and assumed the highest state office.
